intro: Leandra pallida var. brevifolia, commonly known as the pale leandra or slender leandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded gardens due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
